radiographic_examinations.findings: Atelectasis or scarring in the lingula; multiple round hypodense lesions in the liver consistent with cysts; liver diffusely hypodense indicating fatty infiltration; gallbladder minimally distended with significant wall thickening and surrounding fat stranding; multiple gallstones in the gallbladder; biliary findings concerning for acute cholecystitis; portal vein patent; pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands unremarkable; bilateral exophytic cysts of simple fluid density; hyperdense lesion in left kidney previously evaluated as cyst; stomach, duodenum, and small bowel unremarkable; sigmoid diverticulosis in colon; no appendicitis; nonspecific 1.5 cm minimally enlarged lymph node at porta hepatis; urinary bladder unremarkable; no pelvic free fluid or lymphadenopathy; no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions; fat-density lesion in left posterior abdominal wall unchanged from prior study.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Unchanged from prior exam regarding liver cysts and fat-density lesion in left posterior abdominal wall; minimally enlarged lymph node at porta hepatis was noted.
